CONJUGATES: sculpture (base) | sculptures (3rd person singular present) | sculpturing (present participle) | sculptured (past tense/past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin sculptura ('a carving, sculpture'), from sculpere ('to carve').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The art of making two- or three-dimensional representative or abstract forms, especially by carving stone or wood or by casting metal or plaster.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 通过雕刻石头或木头，或铸造金属或石膏等方式，创作二维或三维具象或抽象艺术形式的艺术。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She decided to study sculpture at art school.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她决定在艺术学校学习雕塑艺术。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A work of art created by carving, modeling, or casting.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 通过雕刻、塑造或铸造而成的艺术品。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The museum displayed several ancient Greek sculptures.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 博物馆展出了几件古希腊雕塑。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word or phrase that describes an action, condition, or experience.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To create a work of art by carving or shaping material.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 通过雕刻或塑造材料来创作艺术品。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He chose to sculpture the figure directly from marble.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他选择直接用大理石雕塑这个人物。
